name: GHL Hotel Capital

reviews.text: I was not dissapointed when I chose this hotel for my three night stay in Bogota. The rooms are cleaned and modern. the employees are super helpfull with your needs, the shuttle service to and from the airport is great and the taxi drivers that work with the hotel are very accomodating.
reviews.title: Third time at hotel Capital

reviews.text: Clean modern hotel close to airport. Rooms small but tidy. Skip the restaurant. We came at 9 PM , salad bar looked gross, took them an hour to make soup. Great dining town, you will do better elsewhere. OK place for an early flight.
reviews.title: Fine for overnight

reviews.text: I had the opportunity to stay at the GHL Hotel Capital last year. The room was very cozy and I liked that was very cold outside but the room insulation was excellent!
reviews.title: Also a Great place to stay if you work in Bogota near the Airport!

reviews.text: I even enjoyed a balcony and my stay was very good at this Hotel! The F&B department is god at this Hotel, the breakfast was really nice with a good buffet and a great variety of breads!
reviews.title: excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Congratulations to GHL Hotels for having such a wonderful property in Bogota!
reviews.title: Really nice and convenient!

reviews.text: I stayed here one night as an overnight between flights. The hotel is convenient to El Dorado airport and is located near several other hotels. Check-in was quick and a welcoming drink was handed to me at the front desk while I was checking in. The room had a portable air conditioning unit, which seemed to work well, but even with the air on "high", the room never seemed to get cold. This is odd considering the air temp in Bogota was in the 50's. I got in late, so I didn't have a chance to check out the restaurant and had to leave early, i.e. 4:15am, to catch a very early flight. When I went down to check out just before 4:00am, I asked about printing a document in the Business Center. The Desk Clerk pointed to where the Business Center was and I went in. To my surprise there was a young man in a suit and tie (before 4 am!) sitting there waiting to help anyone in need. Recognize there was no one else on the first floor of the hotel at that time of the morning. He was quite helpful and I was soon on my way.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, a little more formal than some other hotels

reviews.text: Stayed here during a recent off-site conference. The free shuttle from El Dorado airport was a huge bonus. The hotel even sent a photograph of the member of staff that would be waiting to meet me. Check in staff very friendly, although there was a delay in the process because I had booked with GHL Hotels online, and they were having problems matching the rate I had been given. My room was very nice, although temperature control was a little difficult. There is free Wifi throughout the hotel, but there are lots of different networks throughout. This became hugely frustrating because you had to repeatedly log in to a new network whenever you moved around the hotel. I tried the restaurant one evening, food was okay, small portions, and quite expensive. The free buffet breakfast was excellent, made to order omelettes were good, and there was a different choice of tapa-style dish each day. Bread and pastries were excellent. The bar area was small but friendly. As with all hotels in the city, security was tight at the front door, with explosives detection dogs and uniformed staff, but all were friendly.
reviews.title: Very friendly

reviews.text: GHL Hotel Capital is conveniently located close to the airport, but not too close where you won't be able to rest because of the air traffic. If your stay in Bogota is for a couple of days this is the hotel to stay, friendly staff, clean, and the drinks at the bar are fairly priced. Additionally, the breakfast buffet has great healthy options to choose from. If your stay is longer, I don't recommend it. It is about a 20 min cab ride from the Zona T, Parque 93 and zona rosa. The internet is not great, you get disconnected constantly. Finally, the gym could benefit from additional cardio equipment.
reviews.title: Good place for a short stay.
Amazing Restaurant
reviews.text: Confortably hotel for a business trip, very safety and close to the airport. The great tip for this hotel is the restaurant located on the top. The meal is gorgeus and the staff is very friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room isn't big, but is clean and confortably. Also, the hotel offers a floor dedicated for smokers, with, of course, smokers rooms, that is forbbiden in several others hotels in the country.
reviews.title: Could not be better on the few hours we had there

reviews.text: Stayed here multiple times while visiting a client. As the title says, Hotel Capital is an excellent full service hotel. Room is very comfortable, breakfast options are vast (but a bit crowded), and the restaurant at the top of the hotel is simply amazing. Plenty of security. Many dining choices nearby. I have no hesitation recommending Hotel Capital.
reviews.title: Excellent full service hotel for business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were recently on vacation in South America but missed one of our connecting flights so we had to stay the night in Bogota. Our airline made us a reservation at Hotel Capital, and we were very pleasantly surprised. We arrived very late and had to leave very early in the morning, but they were running their shuttle, which made it very easy to get back and forth from the airport, especially at odd hours in a city we weren't expecting to stay in.
reviews.title: Just Passing Through

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is beautiful. It was very nicely decorated with gorgeous fresh flowers everywhere and a very modern design overall.The rooms were very much the same way. Very comfortable and spacious. They were very friendly and accomodating. The hotel staff was amazing. They helped us with our luggage at both check in and check out even though it was very late. The check in process was very smooth even though we didn't have a real reservation. We ordered room service which really hit the spot after a long day of travelling.
reviews.title: Three Day Weekend

reviews.text: Although we didn't have the opportunity to really explore all the hotel had to offer, I would definitely recommend it to anyone in the area. Wish we could have stayed longer!
reviews.title: Cannot fault this establishment

reviews.text: We arrived in late at Bogota Airport, But the Shuttle was right there awaiting us. From that point on the Hotel fully delivered the best possible service throughout our entire stay. We really loved the room , quite comfortable. From the room service to the top line resturaunts we loved it all. Most of the cable channels were English, I am From Texas and not too good with Spanish , so this was great. The only drawback was that the payperview movies and channels were there but were not availible. This is like dangling meat in front of a dog..haha, but if thats the worst thing I can say about this place, then no worries folks book your room here you will not be sorry.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was only there for layover from Cartagena, but the hotel is excellent. The staff is top notch, as are the rooms and it is very reasonably priced for Bogota at about $160 per night. Also, it is only about 5 minutes away from the airport and provides a free shuttle to the airport.
reviews.title: Excellent Airport Layover

reviews.text: I loved this hotel, it was really cozy and I felt like home, its probably because Bogota is beautiful. But it is a normal hotel, clean, and I didnt feel the cold weather at all. Its close to Parque Simón Bolivar and Salitre Magico, I could watch the fireworks of Summer Fest from my window and it looked amazing. Its located in a residential neighborhood so you will have everything you need close to you. Breakfast buffetwas great and fresh.
reviews.title: I loved the view

reviews.text: Simple, comfortable business hotel. The room was comfortable and clean. My room was on the 5th floor and had a balcony, which was a nice bonus. The hotel is conveniently located around a main business sector of the city, and close to the industrial area where I was working at. Not much to do around the hotel though, aside from walking a few blocks to reach the 2 large malls nearby. Yet, Bogota is such a lovely city that i just a cab out and went places.
reviews.title: strictly business

reviews.text: They could work on a few things, like instead of having portable A/C units in the room they could invest on central A/C or if the building doesn't allow, at least split A/C units in rooms. The staff was always curteous, helpful and professional. This was interesting for me because nights were cool, but the surrounding areas were too loud to sleep with the window upen, and the room is warm with the windows closed, and the portable A/C unit was also very loud when on, so my nights at first were a little uncomfortable. Got used to it, though.
reviews.title: Perfect for business

reviews.text: The WIFI (like most hotels in latin america) could be better and not have me sign on to the hotel system every time i turned on the wifi on my cellphone or ipod, or have me sign back on every 10 minutes or so. Otherwise the connection was fast and reliable, and had strong signal everywhere and didn't have issues signing on to VPN and streaming video.
reviews.title: business and families

description: The Capital Hotel offers renovated spaces between those that stand, lobby, meeting rooms, common areas and 216 rooms, all this allows to offer guests all the convenience and comfort, without forgetting the excellent service that has always characterized him, adapting to today's executive.Each room is equipped with:Large and comfortable bed, LCD TV, international TV, Mayor lighting throughout the room and bathroom, minibar, alarm clock with Ipod charger, Side table, Desk, Luggage, Large Closet, Safety deposit box, telephone line ( Rooms junior suite) Rug slip in the bathroom, Marble Vanity, Hair Dryer, Air Stabilizer, evacuation plans, smoke detectors, Splinklers, Internal Security Chain, Eye viewfinder and electronic card system for entry to the room.
